document_data.name: Shillelagh
document_data.mainbody: The '''''shillelagh''''' ({{Pronounce|shi|LAY|la|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|28}}}}) spell enhanced a wooden weapon, such as a [[club]] or a [[staff]] to do more harm in combat.
document_data.Effects: The weapon to be enchanted had to be non-magical, made of [[oak]], and not shod with metal. If someone other than the caster wielded the ''shillelagh'', the bonus to skill and damage did not manifest. The effects lasted for a few minutes; longer for more experienced casters.
document_data.Components: All versions of this spell required an oaken club or staff, the caster's [[holy symbol]] or [[divine focus]], plus [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[Somatic component|somatic]] components. The [[alteration]] versions also required a shamrock leaf, as well as the post-[[Second Sundering]] version, which also required [[mistletoe]].
